summary: Skyrim's Skeletons were always a pushover, most able to sustain only one or two hits. This mod makes them the nuisance they really should be, in the style of Dark Souls.
descriptionHtml:
[font=Impact][size=5][color=green]Announcement[/color][/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=4][color=orange]This mod is officially dead. [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/3946799][b]Roxus13[/b][/url] is developing another mod of the same name. While I'm not sure if it's directly based off of the work from this mod, check out [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/46851][i]Truly Undead - Reborn[/i][/url] for advancements in the field of resurrecting undead.[/color][/size][/font]

[font=Impact][size=5][color=red]Description[/color][/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=4][color=orange]Skyrim's Skeletons were always a pushover, most able to sustain only one or two hits. This mod makes them the nuisance they really should be, in the style of Dark Souls.

Thanks to [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/2645612][b]svaalbard[/b][/url], Youtube's [url=http://www.youtube.com/user/insane0hflex?feature=watch][b]insane0hflex[/b][/url], for an awesome [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eOm1GwUuJV0&list=PL9FCDE9DDD9709AA3]video[/url] showcasing this mod:

[center][youtube]eOm1GwUuJV0[/youtube][/center][/color][/size][/font]

[font=Impact][size=5][color=red]Features (Version 1.0)[/color][/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=4][color=orange]Skeletons will remain with the Vanilla health, and other stats. The major difference caused by this mod is that they will continue to resurrect after they have been killed. They can only be truly "killed" by the wielder of a Silver weapon.[/color][/size][/font]

[font=Impact][size=5][color=red]Features (Version 2.0)[/color][/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=4][color=orange]Dawnbreaker will now also "kill" skeletons. Silver weapons can be crafted. Restoration effects dealing damage to undead will disintegrate skeletons. Fire magic and enchantments will cause skeletons to no longer resurrect. On the technical side, the script now functions exactly as I would like. If anyone has any questions as to how the scripts differ between v1.0 and v2.0, please PM me. As always, if you would like to upgrade, try to fast travel to place without skeletons, wait for a while, uninstall the previous version, and then update (just to be safe).

I have now uploaded new versions for users of Dawnguard and/or Dragonborn, and [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/28957][i]Beast Skeletons[/i][/url] by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/88348][b]PROMETHEUS_ts[/b][/url], as requested, and with thanks to [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/213669][b]tonycubed2[/b][/url] for pointing me in the right direction. It goes without saying that this version would be dependent on [i]Beast Skeletons[/i] and possibly the two mentioned DLCs depending on the version you downloaded, and must be below them in load order.[/color][/size][/font]

[font=Impact][size=5][color=red]Features (Version 2.1)[/color][/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=4][color=orange]Thanks to [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/594058][b]Restutitor Orbis[/b][/url], I was made aware that my mod did not have proper support for the Dawnguard's weapons. This version adds such support. Compared to Version 2.0, this version of the mod will permanently kill skeletons when using the Dawnguard's weapons.[/color][/size][/font]

[font=Impact][size=5][color=red]Features (Version 2.2)[/color][/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=4][color=orange]Again thanks to [b]Restutitor Orbis[/b], I was made aware that my mod did not have proper support for Sunhallowed Elven Arrows. This version adds such support.[/color][/size][/font]

[font=Impact][size=5][color=red]Features (Version 3.0)[/color][/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=4][color=orange]This version completely overhauls the implementation to improve consistency. Previous features are largely maintained. New features/changes include:
- Significantly better implementation of the Silver Bolts, available from the Vampire file.
- Removed ability to craft Silver weapons, because I want the experience to be more like Dark Souls (i.e. if you don't have the right weapons, run!).
- Werewolves can permanently kill Skeletons.
- Attacks from the player will be distinct from attacks from followers/other NPCs. In previous versions, followers without the right weapons/spells could kill Skeletons provided that the player even held a Silver weapon, for example.
- A valid "resurrection-prohibiting" attack will affect the Skeleton for 5 seconds. In previous versions, it would be possible for the player to attack a Skeleton with a correct weapon/spell and have the kill "stolen" by a non-follower NPC, which would mean that the Skeleton would be allowed to resurrect.

Notable is the fact that the file no longer has a dependency on the Dragonborn DLC. As it turns out, there were actually no Skeleton races added by the DLC and I just didn't pay enough attention. Also, the file no longer edits any of the Restoration Spells or the Dawnbreaker, to increase compatibility. Skeletal races that disintegrate upon death (such as the Corrupted Shades in Kilkreath) are left unedited to avoid "double disintegration".

Since it's a new system, a clean install is recommended. Thanks to [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/6828711][b]egocarib[/b][/url] for helping me out with scripting in the use of Silver Bolts.[/color][/size][/font]

[font=Impact][size=5][color=red]Vampire Resurrection (Version 4)[/color][/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=4][color=orange]The resurrection ability is added to Vampires. Compared to previous versions, a new system of implementation dynamically adds the ability to Vampire NPCs with significantly higher consistency. A variety of weapons/spells can be used to permanently kill Vampires including Silver Weapons, Dawnguard Weapons, the Dawnbreaker, offensive Restoration Magic, and Silver Bolts (which are craftable and sold by Sorine Jurard and Gunmar). These Silver Bolts can also permanently kill skeletons, albeit with lower consistency (since that file still uses the old implementation). Vampires that are in a "recovery" state (dead but still able to resurrect) can be cleansed with Garllic by activating the body. The new system also puts an emphasis on compatibility; the only files that will conflict are those that also change Sorine Jurard or Gunmar's merchant chests. It should be noted that "Silver" weapons from other mods may or may not permanently kill Vampires, depending on certain factors.

Two significant new features have been possible to add due to this  new system:
1) Who and what hits the Vampire actually matters. In previous versions, due to limitations with the implementation, a Vampire could be permanently killed even if it was never hit with a Silver Weapon, Restoration spell, etc. You could hold a Silver weapon offhand while killing the Vampire with another weapon, and the script would assume that it was killed with the Silver weapon. By the same mechanic, you could have followers without the necessary weapons/spells kill Vampires as long as the player was holding (and perhaps not even using) a Silver/Dawnguard weapon. The new system ensures that Vampires must be dealt with properly at all times.
2) A Vampire will be killed permanently if it was attacked with a valid weapon/spell within the 5 seconds prior to its death. In previous versions, it was possible for the player to do all the hard work of damaging a Vampire to low health with a valid weapon/spell only to have another NPC swoop in for the kill without a valid weapon/spell, thereby allowing the Vampire to resurrect. It doesn't make any sense and is just annoying. The new system ensures that this is no longer the case.

Since it's a new system, do a clean install if you have previous versions of the Vampire file.

Version 4.1 allows Werewolves to permanently kill Vampires, a trait that has been suggested by a few users, most notably [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/758255/][b]Forteverum[/b][/url].[/color]

[b][color=red]Still not enough?[/color][/b][color=orange] For the Undead-Hunting aficionado, I recommend the fully-compatible [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/38370/][i]Supernatural AI - Vampires and Monsters[/i][/url] by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/2068149][b]WarriorWithin83[/b][/url]. It implements a system where many undead enemies and magical creatures actually possess unique abilities, resistances, and even immunity to some types of attacks. I highly encourage users who enjoyed my mod to check out that mod.[/color][/size][/font]

[font=Impact][size=5][color=red]Optional File - Guide to Support for Skeleton Mods[/color][/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=4][color=orange]This optional file will provide a detailed, step-by-step guide to providing support for any Skeleton mod. It really is a Do-It-Yourself guide because I cannot really respond to all requests that ask for a version with support for a certain Skeleton mod. Part of using mods is learning how to customize mods to your own taste and needs, and I believe that this guide gives an excellent opportunity for users who have never touched the Creation Kit to learn this. Thanks goes to [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/780048][b]u60355[/b][/url] for indirectly inspiring this upload.[/color][/size][/font]

[font=Impact][size=5][color=red]Incompatibilities[/color][/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=4][color=orange]As I was making the mod, it was brought to my attention that my mod might conflict with [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/336241][b]lifestorock[/b][/url]'s [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/24913][i]Skyrim Immersive Creatures[/i][/url]. I have downloaded the above mod, compared it to mine in the CK, and played Skyrim with both mods activated and found no incompatibilities. The only thing to note is that my scripts will not affect [b]lifestorock[/b]'s creatures.

There were questions regarding compatibility with [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/9286][i]SkyRe[/i][/url]. Thanks to [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/4094925][b]lambrioza[/b][/url], initial reports confirm that there are no incompatibilities. [b]lambrioza[/b] also indicated that the effects added by my mod meshed well with some of [i]SkyRe[/i]'s functions with regards to Necromancy-styled play. Further testing may be required to reveal the possibility of more obscure incompatibilities.

It has been brought to my attention (indirectly, through Youtube) that [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/19281][i]Requiem[/i][/url] adds similar features. Since I do not use any serious gameplay overhaul mods, and do not want scorching difficulty (ironic because I'm a Dark Souls fan), I would appreciate it if someone could help me out by testing:
- First, will it crash the game?
- Second, will it cause NPCs to behave in game-breaking manners?

I would also like to make a note that I have received some comments requesting things along the lines of "Is it possible to make your mod [i][b]compatible[/b][/i] with [/color][color=blue][i]<some skeleton mod>[/i][/color][color=orange]?" This mod is perfectly [i][b]compatible[/b][/i] with every skeleton mod there is on the Nexus that I can think of, since compatible simply means that they can co-exist without conflict. So, I simply want to assure everyone that this mod is quite compatible with most other mods. Now, questioning whether my mod directly causes changes to other mods is a different story.[/color][/size][/font]

[font=Impact][size=5][color=red]FAQs[/color][/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=4][color=orange]Is this mod compatible with mods that add new Skeleton races? What about mods that edit existing Skeleton races?[/color]
[color=green]"Compatible" simply means that the mods can coexist without conflict. This mod is perfectly compatible with most Skeleton mods on the Nexus. This is because, the more popular Skeleton mods simply add new Skeleton races. This would include [b]lifestorock[/b]'s [i]Skyrim Immersive Creatures[/i] and [b]PROMETHEUS_ts[/b]'s [i]Beast Skeletons[/i], among many others. This mod will not work with Skeleton mods that edit the existing Skeleton races. This is a very small minority of Skeleton mods.[/color]

[color=orange]I haven't initiated the Companions' questline (and, thus, will not be able to find Silver weapons) and don't plan to involve myself in the Dawnguard's activities (and, thus, will not have access to Dawnguard weapons). How can I defend myself against these "immortal" undead?[/color]
[color=green]Here's a tip: you [b]can[/b] subdue them and then run away.[/color]

[color=orange]Most NPCs in the game (including guards) do not carry the weapons necessary to permanently kill Skeletons. Won't this cause Skeletons to kill everyone and everything in Skyrim?[/color]
[color=green]First, in the Vanilla game, Skeleton attacks on any populated area simply do not occur, as I am aware. Second, even if you have a mod that will generate such a situation, events like that are only triggered when you are in that cell. Thus, you will be there to defend those helpless citizens of Skyrim.[/color]

[color=orange]I love the mod! Can the effects be applied to any other forms of undead?[/color]
[color=green]I already have a Vampire Optional File uploaded. It has been noted that similar files already exist on the Nexus, such as [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/23890/][i]True Death[/i][/url]. I don't mean to be dismissive of anyone's hard work, especially when it is more detailed and refined than mine. However, I have to note that, from the description, that mod makes killing Vampires far more tedious, which (for me) makes gameplay more annoying and burdensome. However, I do believe that that mod will appeal to those who have different opinions than me, so I still highly recommend that you look at that mod first before taking a look at my Optional File.[/color]

[color=orange]I use a mod that allows me to disenchant anti-undead weapons, such as the Dawnbreaker, Silver weapons, and Dawnguard weapons. Except for Dawnbreaker-enchanted weapons, why do the newly enchanted weapons not kill Skeletons.[/color]
[color=green]The Dawnbreaker enchantment works because it causes fire damage, which will kill Skeletons. On the contrary, the reason that Vanilla Silver weapons and Dawnguard weapons kill Skeletons is not their enchantment. This mod's scripts will only register the fact that you are holding a Silver or Dawnguard weapon if you are actually holding those Vanilla weapons. It will not do so if you are holding another weapon that is enchanted with the Silver/Dawnguard enchantments through another mod.[/color]

[color=orange]My follower is wielding anti-undead weapons, but they are still resurrecting. Why is this happening?[/color]
[color=green]You must be using an old version. Please consider updating.[/color]

[color=orange]I don't really like this mod. I want Skeletons to be more threatening through increased damage output and chance resurrection.[/color]
[color=green]You're in luck. By chance, I came across [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/15768/][i]Syynxs Stubborn Skeletons[/i][/url] by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/294328][b]Jjiinx[/b][/url]. I encourage you to check out that mod and decide which you prefer. One of the wonderful things about Skyrim mods is that there is almost always an alternative.[/color]

[color=orange]What mods exist on the Nexus that can make my Skyrim experience even more "Dark Souls-y"?[/color]
[color=green]1) Check out [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/36525/?][i]Scary Ghosts[/i][/url] by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/2262062][b]blacksupernova[/b][/url]. This was a mod requested by me and I think it definitely brings ghosts close to how they are Oblivion and in Dark Souls.
2) Check out [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/36006][i]Ultimate Combat[/i][/url] by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/3841389][b]tktk1[/b][/url]. It revamps the combat system to something that's so much better than the Vanilla system, introducing a parry system and improved movesets for NPCs.
3) Check out [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/36414/][i]Unique Animated Crown[/i][/url] by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/437824][b]Anton0028[/b][/url]. I'm not sure if it was the author's intention, but the new item really resembles the Sunlight Maggot.
4) Check out [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/35572/][i]Improved Potion Animation[/i][/url] by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/6457819][b]DavidSid[/b][/url]. If you love that slight pause required to chug some Estus, this is the mod for you.
5) Check out [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/37096/][i]BadGremlins Spiked Club[/i][/url] by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/609747][b]badgremlin[/b][/url]. It resembles the wondrous Reinforced Club that seems to be a favourite for low-level runs.[/color][/size][/font]

[font=Impact][size=5][color=red]Installation[/color][/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=4][color=orange]You may use the NMM or manually install the mod by extracting the .rar file and merging it with your "Data" folder. I have four versions uploaded based on what DLCs you have and whether you want support for [i]Beast Skeletons[/i] by [b]PROMETHEUS_ts[/b]. Remember to only use one at a time.[/color][/size][/font]

[font=Impact][size=5][color=red]Uninstallation (For all Skeleton Files; and Vampire Files up to v3.2)[/color][/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=4][color=orange]1) Go somewhere that has no Skeletons, Draugr, or Vampires. The best place might be a tavern.
2) Wait for 24 hours for good luck.
3) Save your game.
4) Uninstall the mod, manually or with the NMM.
5) Load your save and wait about 10 seconds.
6) If you are using SKSE and if possible, enter [i]ClearInvalidRegistrations[/i] into the console just to be safe.
7) Save your game again.[/color][/size][/font]

[font=Impact][size=5][color=red]Uninstallation (For Vampire Files from and after v4)[/color][/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=4][color=orange]1) Go somewhere that has no Skeletons, Draugr, or Vampires. Also, stay away from Sorine Jurard and Gunmar (Dawnguard merchant NPCs). The best place might be a tavern. Remove all of your Silver Bolts via console commands.
2) Wait for 24 hours for good luck.
3) Type in the following console commands (without quotes):
- "stopquest BBVamps_VampireAbilityQuestUpdater"
- "stopquest BBVamps_AddVampireAbilityQuest"
- "stopquest BBVamps_AddPlayerGarlicPerkQuest"
- "player.removespell BBVamps_PlayerGarlicPerkSpell"
4) Save your game.
5) Uninstall the mod, manually or with the NMM.
6) Load your save and wait about 10 seconds.
7) If you are using SKSE and if possible, enter [i]ClearInvalidRegistrations[/i] into the console just to be safe.
8) Save your game again.[/color][/size][/font]

[font=Impact][size=5][color=red]Additional Notes[/color][/size][/font]
[font=Verdana][size=4][color=orange]Remember to comment and check out my other mods. Have fun![/color][/size][/font]
author: BrotherBob and Restutitor Orbis
